title: Understanding the Functions and Graph
text:
$$lim_x$$ → -2**- f(x) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-2$$ from the left.
$$lim_x$$ → -2**+ f(x) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-2$$ from the right.
$$lim_x$$ → $$-2$$ f(x) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-2$$ from both sides.
Locate $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-2$$ on the graph and observe the values of f(x) as it approaches that x-value.

title: Finding the Limit
text: What value is f(x) approaching as $$x$$ approaches -2?

title: Limit Value
text: $$lim_x$$ → 1**+ f(x) $$=$$ $$2$$. Looking at the right side of the function as $$x$$ approaches $$1$$, we can see that the value of f(x) approaches $$3$$. Remember that there is no difference with an open or closed circle because a limit is the value the graph is approaching from the right and left sides. In this case, we are looking solely at the right side of the function.\n##figure3.gif##
